name: Swissotel Krasnye Holmy

reviews.text: Knowing traffic in Moscow, Swissotel being close to Pavletskaya Station is perfectly connected to Domodedovo Airport. The hotel is extremly luxury oriented, in line with other swissotel in other countries, most negative is the price per night and that they even have WIFI for free. Service is high level and in English, something rare in Moscow.
reviews.title: Nice Business Hotel, quite expansive, but service and location ideal

reviews.text: This rather new Hotel offers very modern, five star and luxury environment. Rooms are big, with large bathroom and equipment you normally need. The Tower-like building is located nearby a metro station (Pavelezkaya) and offers a great view all over Moscow from the CitySpace bar located at the very top of the hotel. Prices are accordingly high.
reviews.title: Modern, Expensive, but good

reviews.text: If you prefer such modern, clean and non-atmospheric environments, you will like this place. For more Russian style hotels I would recommend other, more traditional places.
reviews.title: Best in Moscow

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel twice before in 2008 also in executive rooms each time. The rooms are large, well appointed and well laid out, all with great views. The exec lounge is excellent, the standard of food and drink provided is just right. The outside terrace is great also, views are stunning.
reviews.title: Always nice to return

reviews.text: The gym and swiming pool are good, the Wi Sports is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel, but...

reviews.text: The Swissotel in Moscow is a rather impressive high rise building a bit outside of the center of Moscow, but located right in the commercial district. A taxi will get you to the Red Square within 15 minutes if traffic allows, as this is a constant problem in Moscow.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Moscow

reviews.text: As I checked in at 4 am in the morning there was no wait and the reception staff was very friendly and efficient. The rooms are very nice and comparatively spacious with all of the amenties one can think of. Furthermore, they were very clean and well kept. The rooms have a modern designer feel to it, but still keep an Eastern European touch with a lot of wood panels. The down to the floor windows offer a nice view over the city, but then I guess this depends on the floor and location of your room. Heating/AC works well and water pressure in the shower is great.
reviews.title: bad

reviews.text: Although I stayed two nights at this hotel I did not have the opportunity to utilize many other facilities. There is a gym, restaurant and lobby bar. I did manage to spend a bit of time in the Sky Bar on the 33rd floor though. The service there was extremely friendly and attentive and the bar offers a great night (and probably day) view over Moscow.
reviews.title: Perfect... a haven of peace, as always. This is the only hotel I would ever choose in Mosocow.

reviews.text: The rooms were tende well during the stay and I surely appreciated the turn down service, which is something one does not find in business hotels in the western hemisphere too often anymore. The check-out procedure was also very friendly and efficient. All in all a very good stay, which is something I would expect though given the rather high room rates.
reviews.title: Great location, fantastic service

reviews.text: Very rude staff working inthe hotel!
reviews.title: 5 star service - 5 star prices

reviews.text: I travelled to the Krasny Holmy when on a business trip, and stayed there as it was near to the office.
reviews.title: Great hotel, not so great location

reviews.text: The service was impeccable, and the facilities were great. The only issue I had (and it's hardly the hotel's fault) is that the location feels a little desolate - there is not much to do in the area (as far as I'm aware). on my next trip I stayed at the Ararat Park Hyatt, simply because it was much closer to the Red Square so there was more to see and do.
reviews.title: The best hotel ever!!!

reviews.text: However, still a lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Agree with all other comments

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel! Everything was great. The room was equiped with toys and activities for our 3 yrs old son. He loved it! The service was excellent and the food was amazing! We will definitely come back. Special thanks to Sayora!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: From Ksenia Proger and Gary Bay from Toronto, Canada
reviews.title: Top Spot for Moscow

reviews.text: I had the chance to spend a few nights at this fantastic hotel, which I definitely recommend. Great and comfy rooms, incredible views (try the 34th floor bar-restaurant opened at night - it will offer you an almost 360-degrees view of Moscow), very competent and helpful staff, great restaurants, good spa and indoors swimming-pool.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay at this 5 stars hotel

reviews.text: Very good location: 5 minutes from Paveletskaya metro and train station, which allows you to be in less than 15 minutes in downtown Moscow (Red Square, Goum, Tsoum , etc..) if you do not wish to spend hours in expensive taxis...
reviews.title: you have to pay for everything.....

reviews.text: Quite expensive but worth the price.
reviews.title: Good if you're not paying...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it is the most popular business hotel in moscou, but not sheap, everything has to be paid on top of the room including the internet which is really very expensive.....
reviews.title: Great hotel, recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is as well very expensive, very nice view in the sky bar .
reviews.title: Nice hotel but certainly room for improvement

description: An award-winning luxury five-star hotel, Swissotel Krasnye Holmy is centrally located in the city’s upscale area and a short distance from the Kremlin and Red Square. Elegantly-appointed rooms and suites, with panoramic views of the city, feature state-of-the-art technology and exclusive amenities for the discerning traveller. World-class accommodations are complemented by first-class cuisine at an array of superb restaurants and bars. The trendy City Space Bar, one of the World’s Top Ten Bars (by the Bartender’s Guide 2008), is located on the top floor of the hotel (140m) and offers breathtaking 360 degree view of Moscow. Purovel Spa & Sport offers an integrated approach combining fitness and relaxation.
